intro: Cenchropsis myosuroides var. longiseta, commonly known as the long-hairy cenchropsis, is a rare and lesser-known plant species within the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinct appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It thrives in specific, often arid or semi-arid environments, making it a challenging species to cultivate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
